customer_reviews.title: I've been using Bliss Spa wax for years. Thrilled ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Bliss Spa wax for years. Thrilled that Amazon carries it now, it's a little less expensive then buying direct. My only complain is not with Amazon, it's with Bliss. I prefer the metal mug that had to be heated in a pot of boiling water. It had twice the amount of wax in it and was a substantial cut. This new version is a cheap plastic cup with half the wax. And you have to microwave it an constantly check on it to make sure you don't scald your skin.
customer_reviews.author: Jezbel

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use and messy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner at waxing, and this was a little hard to use because of how fast the wax dried up in the cup (which made the waxing very messy) and how little wax there was in the cup. I ran out after my second use and I didn't have normal wax strips with me so I had to shave the rest of my hairs, which is definitely not a good idea because it messes up the hair growth cycle of your body...I'm definitely not buying this again
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good at home kit
customer_reviews.text: I've used this in the past and stopped for a bit because it's a little pricey. Honestly it is one of the better products on the market. I must warn you that it is extremely messy. Make sure you follow the warm-up instructions and test on your wrist before applying. Don't skip the pre and post wax oil/lotions. Also, don't put the wax on in huge sections because it will take more applications to fully remove the hair. Overall I can deal with it being messy because it works and removes 98% of hair.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina S.

customer_reviews.title: NOT this one
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give a 1-star rating, rarely does a product actually deserve it, however, this wax hair remover does. Microwaveable, but very difficult to use and maintain a good temperature for use. Messy, strands were everywhere, beware, and make sure you do over a non-staining bathroom top if you decide to buy. I have very fine hair, maybe that's why it didn't grab my hairs, but I literally had no removal, I felt some tugging, but no actual removal at the end of it all. In summary, didn't do what I wanted it to do, difficult to use, messy. I threw mine out. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: eroars

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This used to be my go to waxing product...until Sephora stopped carrying it. Then I went to shaving but it was becoming an absolute pain. I'm so glad I finally found a seller offering this product. Here are some tips for you non believers. Read the instructions. Use the oil before and after waxing. Make the wax layer thick enough to pull. Do not wait until its completely dry or it will crack and make a mess (wait til it is tacky). If there is residual don't pluck away at it since that hurts- put oil on a towel and simply wipe the stuff off.
customer_reviews.author: dbscharl

customer_reviews.title: Works great - must keep reheating
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with this wax the first time because I didn’t reheat it when needed. I recommend for heating the first around about 2 minutes (depending on you microwave watts). Then doing the 30 second intervals to get it the right consistency. You will most likely need to reheat it during the process. That’s the worst part. The wax is great. Smells great. It does get crumbly on you if you’re not reheating as needed. Make sure you’re applying a thick, honey like consistency. Twirl the wand after dipping in the wax and after you’ve applied it to get the wax to stop stretching. The quantity provided was enough for me to do a Brazilian.
customer_reviews.author: rmjeff01

customer_reviews.title: Yup!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never tried at home waxing, not have I ever been waxed by anyone else. I ordered this for stepson’s unibrow (he’s 13, and kids are cruel lol) and the poor kid would sit through me plucking his brow. This is SO MUCH BETTER!!!! So easy to use!!! I’ve even started using it for my brows and legs. Any negative reviews saying that it doesn’t peel off easily or it breaks? Ignore them. Those people aren’t using it correctly. Instructions are very clear, just follow them. Amazing product. Will absolutely order again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend it !
customer_reviews.text: Well it's my first review anywhere on the Internet whatsoever. It's such an amazing product. Almost painless and has such great results! And 1 jar lasts longer than I expected .Yes ,it is expensive a lil bit but given the work it does, it's totally worth it! It leaves ur skin feeling soft and it has a great fragrance too.super easy to use and apply. I am never using any other product for my wax routine again ! :)
customer_reviews.author: LoyalCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Waxing in Quarentine! Great results with a learning curve!
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions twice and followed exactly. It took a lot longer to melt in the microwave, but I waited until it was the perfect consistency. The most important point is spreading enough of the wax -- the thickness of a banana peel is a great reference, then waiting until it is no longer tacky and voila! I completed my first at home Brazilian and underarm with great success. The underarm was actually trickier logistically but still resulted in smooth hairless skin. Definitely use the pre and post waxing oil. This is a great alternative during the pandemic (at least).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasting results

customer_reviews.text: I love this product I feel like I can do it myself at home very easy to use not messy at all also very fast shipping and did not take very long to come
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I do miss the old bliss that you would heat up on the stove but otherwise the wax works great and I don’t break out from it like some cheaper waxes
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Steiner

customer_reviews.title: I’m in love
customer_reviews.text: It’s the beat home wax I have ever used! Sure think I’ll buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Mariana Glomb

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this wax at all. It smells horrible to me.
customer_reviews.author: RML

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this before and it’s my go to waxing kit.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: I do like this wax better then the old wax that you ...
customer_reviews.text: I do like this wax better then the old wax that you have to use the strips but it is not as easy to apply as I thought and doesn't take all the hair out either.
customer_reviews.author: Zule Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I wouldnt of bought this. You have to constantly reheat the wax (which they only give you a small amount of), the applicators sucked, and I have residue left all over my skin that will not come off!! Not to mention it is EXTREMELY messy. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Wirth

customer_reviews.title: Best buy
customer_reviews.text: Works just like the shop. Definitely will save hundreds of dollars. I used it for a Brazilian and have enough for 2-3 more waxes
customer_reviews.author: venus

customer_reviews.title: Works well exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried other brands of wax and I always go back to this. It’s very easy. Over time it’s a bit messy to reheat but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my like probably 6th time buying it and this time I ...
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this is the first time that the waxing kit is weird, breaks, and hard to take it off. This is my like probably 6th time buying it and this time I am very disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: Utter junk. I’m not sure what is wrong with it but it won’t heat in the microwave and instead caused my microwave to short out. I tried it in other units and it won’t heat there either.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Cracked like a mirror rather than being able to rip the strip
customer_reviews.text: I saw good reviews about it being easy to use and no strips. Great I thought! Alas, while it spread ok when I went to rip it off it cracked into a million pieces taking some hair with it but after two tries it was hopeless and disappointing. Maybe I got a bad lot?
customer_reviews.author: Carissa Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Wax was terrible
customer_reviews.text: This was an awful experience. Maybe it was the batch I ordered, but the wax hardened too quickly and almost the entire jar was gone when by the time I finsishes half my calf. So now I have to shave anyways because my wax is almost out. I would not recommend this wax try something else.
customer_reviews.author: natasha smith

customer_reviews.title: NOT microwave safe as the package and instructions state
customer_reviews.text: Cup was not microwave safe. I put it in for the first 30 seconds as advised on the package, and it started sparking like metal does in the microwave. Definitely returning. Did not even get to try it because I could not heat it up. Just pay the extra few dollars for the professional wax warmer kit.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: If you are waxing a large area, good luck
customer_reviews.text: This is barely enough wax to do one lower leg and it only will get some of your hair. You will have to redo it and then run out of wax before you even finish. Very frustrating that I paid this much money without even getting to finish my wax job. Also the wax has an awful smell.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Great at home wax. Without the mess
customer_reviews.text: This is great wax for do it yourselfers. And you might want some on hand if the virus closes things down. Been using it on my upper lip for yrs.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: I used this product years ago and loved it. Bought it again on a whim, but it's not the same. I've used twice and both times it caused terrible breakouts. I can't tell if it's the wax or the oil, but either way the acne is terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Even though it was a little bit messy, this wax worked super well, it didn’t hurt too badly, and it was very easy to use! I would recommend definitely using the oil the kit comes with, laying down some towels, using a mirror, and also baby powder! Will definitely be buying this again!
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: Best wax I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had come across Bliss wax before. Gone now are the many years of crackling waxes that were painful and that took three or more spreads to take the hair away! This wax is supple and grabby and gets the job done the first time around. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Wanderlust

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as EWC!
customer_reviews.text: One notch lower than EWC but for the price it's great to do yourself at home!
customer_reviews.author: DeAnndra

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! Salon waxes are great, but expensive. I find that this to be an effective alternative, especially for stubborn hairs. Can be messy- I normally pad my area with napkins to catch any excess. Not any more painful than a standard wax. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but...
customer_reviews.text: So, the idea of this is great. However. It takes much longer than stated to become a honey like consistency. Once the wax is warm you have to move fairly quickly or it begins to harden and you have to reheat. Not a bad buy but messy and less impressive than my current waxing kit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to use the included pre-wax oil on your skin before spreading the wax.
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit of a learning curve at first as far as using the right amount of wax (thicker wax is MUCH easier to pull off) . I would also recommend sitting on the edge of the tub if using for bikini wax.
customer_reviews.author: abby

customer_reviews.title: Baby Smooth
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to see if I would become consistent enough with at home waxes. I did my legs and my armpits and they are bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Won’t melt
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions to melt the wax and it doesn’t melt at all. It is still hard as a rock after 6 30 second intervals in the microwave. It’s useless. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LRE

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this wax for many years. It's the only at-home waxing product I trust. Works like a charm every time.
customer_reviews.author: JT from NJ

customer_reviews.title: Want my money back!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was horrible!! It took 30-45 minutes to get this wax off of me! It cracked and peeled! Used tweezers to basically pluck the wax and hairs out! Tried this twice!! Definitely isn’t made for bikini waxing!
customer_reviews.author: Ronika Gillon
